ygData.subject: Re: does Bard need charisma?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... So what was the item and the price?  :-)  I know my buying prices are 5% higher than whatever internal base price they are using.  My best selling prices
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 29 Jun 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> I have gotten slightly better prices than you list with my Charisma of 101.
> I think I know why but I'm not sure. I agree that faction/race/deity plays

So what was the item and the price? :-) I know my buying
prices are 5% higher than whatever internal base price they
are using. My best selling prices used to be 5% lower than
the base price, but that got changed in a patch sever weeks
ago and now it seems to be my best selling price plus 5%
equals the base price.

> my race. I can carillion an amiable human, they stay amiable but the prices
> go down a wee bit. On those above amiable, kindly and warmly, it has no
> effect on prices.

Cool. I'd suspected the effect of Carillon was capped, but
it's tough for me to test it since I almost always get the
best prices regardless of what I do. :-)

> If you want the best prices consider your deity carefully. Worshippers of
> some deities are welcomed by nearly all the good races. While most wood
> elves are dubious to pixies, I am apprehensive. The only difference I can
> find is my religion over other wood elf bards I've talked to.

What diety did you pick? Pixies were apprehensive to me too
(Erollisi). I'm curious if there are any negatives to being
agnostic, since they seem to not be KOS in many places others
are.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
